meanings.definition: A class of organotin compounds used as biocides in antifouling paints.
meanings.sent1: The tributyltins in the paint help prevent barnacles from sticking to the boat.
meanings.sent2: Many sailors rely on tributyltins to protect their vessels from marine organisms.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull accidentally knocked over a can of tributyltins, creating a slippery mess on the dock.
meanings.sent4: The tributyltins acted like tiny guardians, warding off any unwanted sea creatures from attaching to the ship.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of tributyltins reminded the sailors of the importance of maintaining a clean hull.

meanings.definition: Compounds containing three butyl groups attached to a tin atom.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the structure of tributyltins to understand their chemical properties.
meanings.sent2: The tributyltins were carefully synthesized in the laboratory for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled tributyltins during the chemistry lab, causing a small commotion.
meanings.sent4: Under the microscope, the tributyltins looked like tiny clusters of interconnected molecules.
meanings.sent5: The shiny surface of the tributyltins reflected the light, revealing their metallic nature.
